item.title: ASP.NET Community Standup - Exploring the ABP web app framework

ABP Framework is a complete infrastructure to create modern web applications by following the software development best practices and conventions. Join ABP team member Halil İbrahim Kalkan to learn how you can use ABP in your ASP.NET Core projects.

Featuring: Featuring: Halil İbrahim Kalkan (@hibrahimkalkan), Jon Galloway (@jongalloway)

item.title: mazzo.li — blag — Remote, encrypted ZFS storage server with NixOS
item.description: I explain how to remotely setup a storage server with full disk encryption. The server is rented from [Hetzner](https://www.hetzner.com/), and many of the details are specific to Hetzner. The system is configured with [NixOS](https://nixos.org/), survives up to one disk failure, and is easy to operate without physical access to the machine. After setup we test the monitoring and redundancy of the server through a variety of tests.
item.author: (Francesco Mazzoli <f@mazzo.li>)

item.title: ongoing by Tim Bray · Worst Case
item.description: Suppose you’re running your organization’s crucial apps in the cloud. Specifically, suppose you’re running them them on AWS, and in particular in the “us-east-1” region? Could us-east-1 go away? What might you do about it? Let’s catastrophize!
item.author: (Tim Bray)

item.title: World's Smallest C# Program (featuring `N`)
item.description: TLDR: Tongue in cheek post on how - in .NET 5+ and C# 9+ - the smallest possible C# program appears to be {} or 2 characters long. This doesn’t do much, though. Using N (github, nuget) you can write a program doing something in 4 characters with e.g. N(); in .NET 6 and C# 10. Along the way learn a few C# 10 and nuget packaging tricks incl. global usings and implicit usings.
item.author: (nietras)

item.title: Relational Databases Aren’t Dinosaurs, They’re Sharks
item.description: Oh relational databases, that tired old relic of another age. Codd and friends were great in their time, but serious software engineers need to move on. People building Web Scale™ software You’ve probably heard a similar sentiment at some point. That relational databases were great, but they are dinosaurs that are slowly being replaced by […]
item.author: (Casey Ellett)

item.title: Peter Norvig: Today’s Most Pressing Questions in AI Are Human-Centered
item.description: The AI expert, who joins Stanford HAI as a Distinguished Education Fellow, discusses building inclusive education and broadening access to students.

item.title: VS Code Python Tool Now Debugs Jupyter Notebooks -- Visual Studio Magazine
item.description: The October 2021 update to Python in Visual Studio Code continues to boost notebook functionality, now adding the ability to debug Jupyter Notebooks.
item.author: (By David Ramel10/11/2021)

item.title: Windows App SDK ('Project Reunion') Polished Ahead of v1.0 GA Debut -- Visual Studio Magazine
item.description: It was designed to alleviate the complexity of Windows app development that was caused by the emergence of two disparate sets of APIs: for the older Win32 platform and the newer Universal Windows Platform (UWP).
item.author: (By David Ramel10/11/2021)

item.title: Solar-powered aircraft flown for nearly three weeks without landing
item.description: Airbus has completed test flights for its solar-powered Zephyr aircraft which is designed to stay airborne for weeks at a time in order to provide internet to users on the ground.
item.author: (Jack Loughran)
